page.title: 17ABBOTSKERSWELL CHURCH
page.content: Abbotskerswell's village church dates from the 13th century and has the oldest wooden lych gate in England.The crossbeam was replaced in 1603. By the lychgate is a tomb made in the 16 hundreds.There is also a Yew tree which is very old and is by the tomb. The church is dedicated to the Virgin Mary. While the church was being restored by Captain and Mrs Hare a statue of the Virgin Mary was discovered behind some plaster. John Lee's sister (Mary Lee) is buried in the grave yard. There are two services each Sunday morning as well as a Junior Church (Sunday School). As with many village churches the number of worshipers is declining and the vicar is concerned for the future of the church community.
